Detailed Description

All rendered objects extend from the Sprite base class.

The Sprite class handles all rendering of any game object. This includes animations, scale, and position.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Sprite::AnimationOption

enum for animation control codes.

Enumerator:
LOOP_ANIMATION  returns to the first frame of animation. Loops infinitely.
GOTO_NEXT_ANIMATION  Goes to the next animation. Should not be set as the control code of the last animation.
MAINTAIN_LAST_FRAME  Maintains the last frame of animation.
KILL_SPRITE  When the last frame is reached, the sprite is destroyed.
GOTO_DEFAULT_ANIMATION  Goes to the default animation (animation #0).

Member Function Documentation

bool Sprite::UseTiles ( Tile *  Tiles,
char  TextureNum 
)

Specifies the Tile set to use, and which Texture within the tileset to use.

Example usage: m_Tiles.Create(&m_Graphics, 1); m_Tiles.Load(0, "Data\\Ego.png", 180, 240); m_Ego.UseTiles(&m_Tiles, 0);

Returns:
TRUE if the tileset is not null

void Sprite::Create ( char  TileNum,
std::string  name,
long  XPos,
long  YPos 
)

Creates a renderable sprite.

Create should be called only after UseTiles().

Parameters:
TileNum Starting tile number to use (generally 0).
name Name of the sprite (should be unique for parsing purposes)
XPos X-Coordinate of the sprite.
YPos Y-Coordinate of the sprite.

bool Sprite::CreateAnimationSequence ( int  animationNumber,
int  startFrame,
int  endFrame,
AnimationOption  nOption 
)

Creates a new animation sequence.

Parameters:
animationNumber The numberID of the animation.
startFrame The starting frame in the Sprite's tileset.
endFrame The ending frame in the Sprite's tileset.
nOption Animation option (see enum AnimationOption ).

bool Sprite::SetAnimation ( int  animationNumber  ) 

Sets the current animation of the sprite.

Returns:
FALSE if animationNumber is greater than the current number of animations.

bool Sprite::decFrame (  ) 

Decrements the current frame.

Returns:
TRUE if the decrement is legal.

bool Sprite::Render (  ) 

Renders the sprite.

If the sprite is invisible or dead, it is not rendered.

Returns:
TRUE if rendering is possible, or if the sprite is dead or invisible.

void Sprite::SetXScale ( float  Scale  ) 

Sets the current X-Scale to Scale.

The scale is absolute, not cumulative. SetXScale(0.5f) followed by SetXScale(0.5f), sets the absolute scale to 0.5 the original.

void Sprite::SetYScale ( float  Scale  ) 

Sets the current Y-Scale to Scale.

The scale is absolute, not cumulative. SetYScale(0.5f) followed by SetYScale(0.5f), sets the absolute scale to 0.5 the original.

RECT Sprite::GetRect (  ) 

Returns the srpite's current AABB.

This funtion is preferred over GetBoundingRect().

Member Data Documentation

int Sprite::m_Animations[TOTAL_ANIMATIONS][3] [protected]

Array where all animations are stored.

[][0] = starting Frame, [][1] = number of Frames, [][2] = end control code (see enum AnimationOption)
